title: Reopen last closed window vs last tab of window
content:
Hi. After some Firefox update that I don't remember, Ctrl+Shift+N and Ctrl+Shift+T now reopen the last closed tab, from whatever window it was...

So how do I get it back to how it was? xD

I'd like to reopen the last closed tab from the current window *only* with Ctrl+Shift+T and the last window however it was closed (with 1 or 39 tabs) with Ctrl+Shift+N. Is this possible?

Thank you.

title: added email addres to monitoring but can't access breaches
content:
I signed up for monitoring and added another address. Under the page marked Monitor Settings (https://monitor.firefox.com/user/settings) the added address appears but there is no way to click on it to find data breaches. If I click on it it just highlights the text so I can cut/paste. What am I doing wrong?

Thanks in advance
creator: princestudios

title: Gmail search results capture keyboard shortcuts
content: Hi, I'm running Firefox 118.0.1 on Ubuntu 23.04, with no plugins and extensions disabled. In gmail, if I type into the search box, gmail shows an instant set of search results as a drop down list from the search box. The problem is that if my mouse happens to be over where that list appears, then often, once the list appears, subsequent keystrokes are misinterpreted as keyboard shortcut commands, rather than additional characters to add to the text in the search box (the focus is on the search box while I'm typing). This doesn't happen in Chrome, but I'm not sure if it's a Firefox or Gmail issue. Anyone else see this? Josh
creator: redstone1

title: Search Settings
content:
Hi,

I use Firefox, have done for a long time, in the Settings, Search, Search Shortcuts I have Google ticked and it still has the tick in it. I have deleted Bing as a Search Engine.

I have always used Google, it's in my Bookmarks, in my Bookmarks toolbar, I just click on the Google tab and search.........................up until now.

When I click on the Google tab, it takes me to Google Search, I type in what I'm looking for and when I just press return or click on Google Search it immediately shows the results in Microsoft Bing.

I do not know why this has happened and I am a little puzzled as I do not like Bing and actively avoid it.

Please could someone let me know what has happened, thank you for your time and consideration.

regards,

Sarah
creator: sjohno

title: How do I completely turn off translation?
content: I cannot find an option in the settings to completely turn off translations. But now firefox (I am on version 119, windows) continues checking (and asking for each language) wether I want something translated. How can I turn translations off completely?

title: Can't play twitter and reddit videos/gif in Firefox
content:
My OS is ubuntu20.046LTS, and the Firefox is 118.0.2. Just like the images i post, i can't play the videos at all, but i can play the youtube videos. The developer tools console in twitter video post shows 2 errors: 

 The Content-Security-Policy: The page’s settings blocked the loading of a resource at data:i (“object-src”);  The connection to https://api.twitter.com/live_pipeline/events?topic= was lost while loading the page.

I thought my problem may be related to these errors so i post them. Alough i can play the videos in chrome normally, but i used to the Firefox, please help me

content:

It can't be right, I'm not talking about a lot of sites, all at once, all at the same time. Something is broken.

For example, https://webmail.iinet.net.au/ is not dodgy, it's my ISP (part of the TPG group, second biggest in Australia, been around for many years). And since I can't access email I won't necessarily know when you've responded.
